docs.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of doctors across the country have been boycotting drug products made by Merck & Company, one of the world's largest drug manufacturers, in a bitter fight over the collective bargaining rights of doctors, pharmacists and other health care professionals. Leaders of the Federation of Physicians and Dentists, a labor union, called the boycott several weeks ago -- to punish Merck, they said, for its position on legislation pending in Congress.

headline.main: Doctors in Antitrust Fight Boycott Merck Products

docs.abstract: Hundreds of doctors nationwide are boycotting drug products made by Merck & Company, one of world's largest drug manufacturers, in bitter fight over collective bargaining rights of doctors, pharmacists and other health care professionals; leaders of Federation of Physicians and Dentists, labor union, is punishing company for its position opposing legislation pending in Congress that would grant antitrust waiver to physicians and other health care professionals making it easier for them to band together to negotiate with health insurance plans and managed care companies; company has stake in legislation since its has subsidiary that manages drug benefits for 52 million people (M)
docs.snippet: Hundreds of doctors across the country have been boycotting drug products made by Merck & Company, one of the world's largest drug manufacturers, in a bitter fight over the collective bargaining rights of doctors, pharmacists and other health care...

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: HEALTH MAINTENANCE ORGANIZATIONS AND MANAGED CARE

docs.lead_paragraph: The weather was miserable. A cold rain, whipped by strong winds, had laced the city for the better part of two days. Some of the reporters and politicians making their way to City Hall on Friday had been soaked. The media crush was so great the press conference had to be held in the Public Hearing Room, instead of the elegant and more intimate Blue Room, where most mayoral press conferences are held.

headline.main: In America; Giuliani's Change Of Heart

docs.abstract: Bob Herbert Op-Ed column says Mayor Rudolph Giuliani's new efforts to radiate warmth and compassion, following withdrawal from US Senate race, is too little too late (M)
